title: Orel Yoshia
text:
I am an Institutional Research Analyst at Florida Polytechnic University. I work with University related data and create and analyze reports internally and externally. I am also the Data Cookbook Administrator at Florida Poly and have implemented a central repository of data definitions and a data governance tool.
I am also an adjunct Professor and have taught 2 Sections of Introduction to Data Science and 1 Section of Cloud Infrastructure & Services
I‚Äôm a recent Master‚Äôs Graduate from Florida Polytechnic University, in Computer Science - Data Science Track. My research was in Course Curriculum and Network Modeling.

title: Embracing Accountability, Discovering Data Science, and Sharing My Journey
text:
Hello, and welcome to my personal corner of the internet! I‚Äôm excited to kick off my blogging journey by sharing a bit about myself, my transformative experience in data science, and why I‚Äôm so passionate about it. This blog isn‚Äôt just about data; it‚Äôs about storytelling with data, sharing my love for data science, and embracing accountability to keep pushing the boundaries of what I can achieve.
From Computer Science to Data Science: A Personal Evolution:
As a fresh computer science graduate with a focus on cybersecurity, I initially thought I had found my calling. However, as time passed, I realized that something was missing. While I respected the field, it didn‚Äôt ignite that unmistakable spark of passion within me. I knew I somewhat liked coding but when I took a statistics course, I felt like that was more of the path I wanted to take.
It wasn‚Äôt until I embarked on my journey toward a Master‚Äôs in Data Science that I discovered my true calling. The world of data analysis, visualization, and storytelling became my newfound love. I realized that my heart resonated with the power of data, its stories, and the insights waiting to be unlocked.
My Passion for Storytelling with Data:
One of the things that fuels my passion for data science is the art of storytelling with data. It‚Äôs not just about numbers and figures; it‚Äôs about crafting narratives that make data come alive. Whether it‚Äôs unraveling the secrets of Black Friday shopping patterns or creating a tool to help people find their perfect perfume or cologne based on their style, I revel in the creative process of turning data into stories that engage, inform, and inspire.
A Glimpse into My Projects:
Many of my projects in the classroom revolved around analyzing course curricula and exploring different degrees throughout the United States. It was during these projects that I honed my skills and discovered the beauty of data analysis. I have also delved into the fascinating world of Black Friday shopping behavior. The patterns, trends, and insights that emerge from this data are both intriguing and valuable. I can‚Äôt wait to share more about this project with you in future posts.
One project, in particular, has captured my heart and will be a focus of my future endeavors:

Perfume and Cologne Selection Tool: Selecting the perfect scent can be an overwhelming task. I‚Äôve been working on a tool that helps you find fragrances that match your style and personality. Stay tuned as I expand on this project, sharing tips and insights on scent selection.

Embracing Accountability and My Website‚Äôs Mission:
This website and, more importantly, these blog posts, serve as my accountability partners. They are a commitment to continue working on my personal projects and to keep sharing my passion for data, data analysis, and data science with all of you.
I invite you to join me on this journey. Let‚Äôs explore the fascinating world of data together, break down complex concepts, and turn data into stories that inspire and inform. I can‚Äôt wait to hear your thoughts, questions, and experiences along the way.
Thank you for being a part of my inaugural blog post. Together, we‚Äôll embrace accountability, dive deeper into data science, and embark on an exciting journey of discovery and creativity. Let‚Äôs make data not just informative, but also inspiring and fun.
I‚Äôd love to hear from you! Feel free to share your own experiences with data or if you would ever like to collaborate on anything in the future. You can message me on LinkedIn, and let‚Äôs embark on this data-driven adventure together.
